metadata.job_to_be_done: {"task": "Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items."}

subsection_analysis.refined_text:
Pancakes 
Ingredients: 
• 
1 cup all-purpose flour 
• 
2 tablespoons sugar 
• 
1 teaspoon baking powder 
• 
1/2 teaspoon baking soda 
• 
1/4 teaspoon salt 
• 
1 cup buttermilk 
• 
1 large egg 
• 
2 tablespoons melted butter 
• 
1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
Instructions: 
• 
In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. 
• 
In another bowl, combine buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. 
• 
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. 
• 
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it. 
• 
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. 
• 
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown. 
• 
Serve with syrup and your favorite toppings. 
 
 
 
Scrambled Eggs 
Ingredients: 
• 
4 large eggs 
• 
1/4 cup milk 
• 
Salt and pepper to taste 
• 
1 tablespoon butter 
Instructions: 
• 
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. 
• 
Heat a non-stick

 
1 teaspoon thyme 
 
1 teaspoon rosemary 
 
1/4 cup olive oil 
 
Salt and pepper to taste 
Instructions: 
 
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
 
In a large baking dish, layer diced eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, onion, and tomatoes. 
 
In a bowl, mix minced garlic, olive oil, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. 
 
Pour the mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat. 
 
Bake for 45 minutes until vegetables are tender. 
 
Serve warm. 
 
 
 
Roast Chicken 
Ingredients: 
 
1 whole chicken 
 
1 lemon, halved 
 
4 cloves garlic, minced 
 
1/4 cup olive oil 
 
1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped 
 
1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped 
 
Salt and pepper to taste 
Instructions: 
 
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
 
Season the chicken with salt and pepper. 
 
Stuff the cavity with lemon halves and minced garlic. 
 
In a bowl, mix olive oil, chopped rosemary, and chopped thyme. 
 
Brush the mixture over the chicken. 
 
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour

 
Return chicken to the skillet and cook until heated through. 
 
Serve warm. 
 
 
 
Peking Duck 
Ingredients: 
 
1 whole duck 
 
1/4 cup soy sauce 
 
1/4 cup honey 
 
2 tablespoons hoisin sauce 
 
2 tablespoons rice vinegar 
 
2 cloves garlic, minced 
 
1 teaspoon five-spice powder 
 
1 teaspoon grated ginger 
 
1/4 cup green onions, sliced 
 
Mandarin pancakes for serving 
Instructions: 
 
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
 
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, five-spice 
powder, and grated ginger. 
 
Brush the mixture over the duck. 
 
Place duck on a roasting rack and roast for 1 hour and 30 minutes until skin is crispy. 
 
Let rest before carving. 
 
Serve duck with sliced green onions and mandarin pancakes.

 
4 pork cutlets 
 
1/2 cup flour 
 
2 eggs, beaten 
 
1 cup breadcrumbs 
 
1/4 cup vegetable oil 
 
1 lemon, sliced 
 
Salt and pepper to taste 
Instructions: 
 
Season pork c

Churros 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 cup water 
o 1/2 cup butter 
o 1 cup flour 
o 3 eggs 
o 1/4 cup sugar 
o 1 teaspoon cinnamon 
o Oil for frying 
 
Instructions: 
o Bring water and butter to a boil. 
o Add flour and stir until a dough forms. 
o Remove from heat and beat in eggs one at a time. 
o Heat oil in a pan. 
o Pipe dough into hot oil and fry until golden. 
o Drain on paper towels and roll in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Coconut Rice 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 cup rice 
o 1 cup coconut milk 
o 1 cup water 
o 1/4 cup shredded coconut 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté shredded coconut until lightly browned. 
o Add rice, coconut milk, water, and salt. 
o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Coleslaw 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 small cabbage 
o 2 carrots 
o 1/2 cup mayonnaise 
o 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar 
o 1 tablespoon sugar 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Shred cabbage and grate carrots. 
o Mix mayo

o 2 cloves garlic 
o 4 tomatoes 
o 4 cups vegetable broth 
o 1 teaspoon cumin 
o 1 teaspoon coriander 
o 1 teaspoon turmeric 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
o 1/4 cup cilantro 
 
Instructions: 
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. 
o Add diced tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander, 
turmeric, and salt. 
o Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. 
o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. 
 
Horta 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 pound dandelion greens 
o 1/4 cup olive oil 
o 1/4 cup lemon juice 
o 1 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. 
o Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. 
o Serve warm or chilled. 
 
Hot and Sour Soup 
 
Ingredients: 
o 4 cups chicken broth 
o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 
o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots 
o 1/4 cup tofu 
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar 
o 1 tablespoon cornstarch 
o 1 teaspoon chili paste 
o 1 egg 
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions 
 
Instructions: 
o

o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 
o Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble. 
o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. 
o Place pie crust in a pie dish and sprinkle with bacon, onion, and cheese. 
o Beat eggs with cream, salt, and pepper, then pour over the filling. 
o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. 
o Serve warm. 
 
Quindim 
 
Ingredients: 
o 2 cups sugar 
o 1 cup coconut 
o 1/4 cup butter 
o 10 egg yolks 
o 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
 
Instructions: 
o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). 
o Mix sugar, coconut, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a bowl. 
o Pour mixture into greased muffin tins. 
o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. 
o Let cool before removing from tins. 
o Serve chilled. 
 
Raita 
 
Ingredients: 
o 1 cup yogurt 
o 1/2 cucumber 
o 1/4 cup mint 
o 1/4 teaspoon cumin 
o 1/4 teaspoon salt 
 
Instructions: 
o Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture. 
o Mix yogurt with cucumber, chopped mint, cumin, and salt. 
o Serve chill
